       </a>

        <!-- PAV_Tahoe_z3 -->
       </h3>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="grid-col col80">
      <div class="content-element ">
       <h3 class="content-title">
        <!--PAV zone 3-->
       </h3>
       <div class="content">
        <link href="http://www.snow.com/~/media/Files/SnowZoneCSS/seo-style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
        <link href="http://www.snow.com/~/media/Files/SnowZoneCSS/seo-pav-style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="interior-hero" data-duration="" data-numrotations="" data-type="hero" id="interior-hero">
       <img alt="" height="245" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/pavzone3heros/best_restaurants_in_south_lake_tahoe_hero.ashx" title="" width="732"/>
      </div>
      <div class="main-header">
       <h1 class="page-title">
        Untrodden Tastes
        <span>
         Up-and-coming restaurants in South Lake Tahoe
        </span>
       </h1>
      </div>
      <div class="sub-grid-container grid3-1">
       <div class="grid-col col100">
        <div class="page-body">
         <!-- By Line -->
         <div class="article-author">
          By:
          <a href="/author-bios/helen-olsson-bio.aspx">
           Helen Olsson
          </a>
          <img alt="" class="author-image" src="/~/media/images/snow/author images/HelenOlsson -50p.ashx?la=en"/>
         </div>
         <!-- End By Line -->
         <!-- Article Content -->
         <ul class="article-content-nav">
          <li>
           The Best of the Best
          </li>
          <li>
           <span>
            Spicy Flavor: Azul Latin Kitchen
           </span>
          </li>
          <li>
           <span>
            Cozy Romance: Cafe Fiore
           </span>
          </li>
          <li>
           <span>
            5 Stars: Jimmy's Restaurant
           </span>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <!-- End Article Content -->
         <p>
          Despite its reputation as a destination with world-class skiing and gaming, South Lake Tahoe has not always been known as a mecca for gourmands.
         </p>
         <p>
          Honestly, our food scene has lagged behind a bit compared with other destinations and metropolitan areas, says Nick Ashmore, owner of
          <a href="http://www.cafefiore.com/" target="_blank">
           Caf Fiore
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          Twelve years ago, you could count the good restaurants on one hand.
         </p>
         <img alt="The South Lake Tahoe Foodie Scene" class="img-left" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/downtown_south_tahoe/southtahoe_0044.ashx?la=en&amp;h=333&amp;w=250" style="height: 333px; width: 250px;"/>
         <p>
          But for foodies, the south shore is experiencing a renaissance with more and more new hotels, shopping centers, and restaurants cropping up.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ashmore says the Marriott complex has finally taken hold, with luxury retail and high-end restaurants settling in.
         </p>
         <p>
          Theres also a new downtown project nearing completion called The Chateau, which will house more restaurants. And with a new Hard Rock Hotel coming to town, optimism abounds.
         </p>
         <p>
          With the recession, the dining options in South Lake went downhill, says Hard Rock executive chef Jonathan Snyder, who worked in his parents restaurant, the Dorys Oar in South Lake Tahoe, in the 1980s and has since ascended in the culinary world, working alongside the likes of Jean-Georges Vongerichten at the Bellagios Prime Steakhouse.
         </p>
         <p>
          Things are turning around now, Snyder says. Chefs are sourcing higher-quality ingredients.
         </p>
         <p>
          The revival is good news for epicureans, whose options for vibrant happy hours and unforgettable dinner experiences are on the rise.
         </p>
         <p>
          More dining options means restaurateurs need to work hard to win diners loyalty, however.
         </p>
         <blockquote>
          I think competition is good. It means you need to bring your A game.
         </blockquote>
         <br/>
         <h2>
          Upcycled, South of the Border:
          <a href="http://www.azullatinkitchen.com/" target="_blank">
           Azul Latin Kitchen
          </a>
         </h2>
         <img alt="" class="img-right" height="167" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/for_helen_olsson/azul_latin_kitchen/azul_latin_kitchen1010515.ashx?la=en" width="250"/>
         <p>
          A trip to Azul Latin Kitchen is worth it just to marvel in the environmentally friendly dcor.
         </p>
         <p>
          The restaurants back bar is comprised of old dressers, nightstands, and book cases, with bottles of tequila stacked inside.
         </p>
         <p>
          Chandeliers modeled from old milk crates hang overhead.
         </p>
         <p>
          The terminology we use is upcycling, says partner Danny Scott, adding that the inspiration comes from San Francisco restaurants like La Urbana, which uses recycled material to create funky backdrops.
          <strong>
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Azul opened serendipitously just a few months ago, on July 24.
         </p>
         <p>
          Unbeknownst to us, it was National Tequila Day, Scott says.
         </p>
         <p>
          And its fitting: The restaurant has 40 tequilas on the bar menu, and mixologists employ freshly-squeezed juices in its house-made margaritas.
         </p>
         <!-- Pro Tip -->
         <section id="highlight">
          <div class="protip right">
           <h3>
            Pro Tip
           </h3>
           <p>
            Try the signature dish Lomo Saltado, a Peruvian-inspired plate of slow-cooked beef over a saut of peppers and onions, fingerling potatoes, green rice and cilantro, with a dollop of queso fresco.
           </p>
          </div>
         </section>
         <!-- End Pro Tip -->
         <p>
          Located at the base of
          <a href="http://www.skiheavenly.com/" target="_blank">
           Heavenly
          </a>
          perfect for aprsAzul is the brainchild of the same restaurateurs who own the nearby, popular Base Camp Pizza.
         </p>
         <p>
          Chef Mark Vaccaro traveled extensively through South and Central America, and he brings that field experience to Azuls menu.
         </p>
         <p>
          The restaurants signature dish is the Lomo Saltado, a Peruvian-inspired plate of slow-cooked beef over a saut of peppers and onions, fingerling potatoes, green rice and cilantro, with a dollop of queso fresco.
         </p>
         <p>
          The taco menu is inventive, too. Tacos are stuffed with such surprises as Thai curry, pork belly, and coconut beef.
         </p>
         <p>
          Throughout the menu, Chef Vaccaro uses organic produce from the Sacramento Valley and sustainably raised, antibiotic-free meats.
         </p>
         <!-- Reviews -->
         <div class="panel">
          <div class="toogle-box">
           <h3 class="toggle-box-heading">
            Review: Azul Latin Kitchen
            <span class="author">
             By
             <a href="/author-bios/clark-vandeventer-bio.aspx">
              Clark Vandeventer
             </a>
             <img alt="" class="author-image" src="/~/media/images/snow/author images/ClarkVandeventer -50p.ashx?la=en"/>
            </span>
           </h3>
           <div class="close toggle-box-content">
            <p>
             Bring your Chapstick.
            </p>
            <p>
             Thats one little piece of advice I can give you, because this place makes the best margaritas in Tahoe, but when the salt touches your lips in the already dry air, youre going to want that extra coat of moisture.
            </p>
            <p>
             My personal favorite is the Smoky Jalapeno, which Id describe as a margarita for whiskey drinkers.
            </p>
            <p>
             Take a big salty sip, savor, and pull out that Chapstick.
            </p>
            <img alt="Azul Margaritas" class="img-left" height="375" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/for_helen_olsson/azul_latin_kitchen/azul_latin_kitchen2010515.ashx?la=en" width="250"/>
            <p>
             Whether its mixing candied jalapeos with pickled mangos in the Thai Curry Taco or the peppers and goat cheese in their Garden Fajita Taco, this place does not lack in creativity. The entres are just as good.
            </p>
            <p>
             My wife and I are partial to the Enchilada Suizas and the Pulled Pork Flauta.
            </p>
            <p>
             The vibe is both hip and welcoming. Theres live music regularly, and its got that touch of authenticity and integrity achieved only in a restaurant, like here, where you can spot the owner busing tables. Managing partner Danny Scott is darn good, and looks after every little detail.
            </p>
            <p>
             Thats why
             <a href="http://www.azullatinkitchen.com/" target="_blank">
              Azul Latin Kitchen
             </a>
             is my go-to place in South Tahoe. If you slide into the bar after a day of shredding at Heavenly, theres a good chance youll be sitting next to me while Im knocking back a Smoky Jalapeo.
            </p>
           </div>
           <a class="toggle-arrow right">
            <em class="fa fa-chevron-down">
            </em>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!-- End Reviews -->
         <br/>
         <h2>
          Old-School Romantic:
          <a href="http://www.cafefiore.com/" target="_blank">
           Caf Fiore
          </a>
         </h2>
         <img alt="Cafe Fiore Lake Tahoe" class="img-left" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/fiore/fiore_stahoe_0044.ashx?la=en&amp;h=188&amp;w=250" style="height: 188px; width: 250px;"/>
         <p>
          Situated between the shores of Lake Tahoe and the base of Heavenly, Caf Fiore is a special-occasion restaurant housed in an A-frame that once served as haven for 1960s-era hippy ski bums.
         </p>
         <p>
          With original redwood paneling cocooning diners, it has a cozy cabin feel and northern Italian cuisine.
         </p>
         <p>
          During peak times, make reservations: Caf Fiore has but seven tables. If its your anniversary or birthday, were that restaurant you pull out a special dress for, owner Nick Ashmore says.
         </p>
         <p>
          Menu standouts include the eggplant crepe appetizer, which was featured in
          <em>
           Gourmet
          </em>
          magazine (thinly sliced eggplant and smoked salmon, with a sherry-cream and sun-dried tomato sauce).
         </p>
         <p>
          The Di Mare alla Fiore main dish marries prawns and scallops in a white wine, caper, and lemon-butter sauce, served over a bed of linguini.
         </p>
         <p>
          Save room for the house-churned white-chocolate ice cream. Its based on an old family recipe we inherited with the restaurant, says Ashmore. We make a gallon daily.
          <strong>
          </strong>
         </p>
         <br/>
         <h2>
          <a href="http://thelandingtahoe.com/dining/" target="_blank">
           Jimmys Restaurant
          </a>
         </h2>
         <img alt="Chef Maria Elia - Jimmy's restaurant" class="img-right" height="375" src="/~/media/images/snow/zonepages/pavzone3/for_helen_olsson/jimmys_landing/chef maria elia smaller010515.ashx?la=en" width="250"/>
         <p>
          Jimmys at The Landing Resort &amp; Spa, a new five-star boutique lakeside hotel in South Lake Tahoe, offers up wood-fired Greek and regional California cuisine from celebrity chef Maria Elia, author of
          <em>
           Smashing Plates: Greek Flavors Redefined
          </em>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          Elia, whose family comes from Cyprus, brings a modern, fresh approach to the traditional Greek fare she grew up with.
         </p>
         <p>
          Guests tuck into private dining alcoves with fireplaces for the katafi-wrapped feta with raisin-oregano dressing and carrot keftedes, or the pulled-lamb burger with beetroot tzatziki.
         </p>
         <p>
          Jimmys earned the 2014
          <em>
           Wine Spectator
          </em>
          Award of Excellence for its glass-enclosed wine cellar, which features more than 2,000 hand-selected bottles from 250 labels.
         </p>
         <p>
          Pair Elias inventive plates with a Greek wine, or sidle up to the backlit, onyx-walled bar for a Greek mojito made with ouzo. The vibe here is hip and contemporaryand the views of Lake Tahoe are unparalleled.
         </p>
        </div>
